titles.title: Mäṣḥafä śǝnä fǝṭrät “Book of the Beauty of Creation’’ / ʾAmmǝstu ʾaʿmadä mǝsṭir “The Five Pillars of Mystery’’

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäṣḥafä śǝnä fǝṭrät "Book of the Beauty of Creation" (fols. 3r-98v). In Amharic (cp. EMML no. 1392) I-1) Introduction: a treatise on creation (fols. 3r-5v) I-2) Sunday (fols. 6r-24r) I-3) Monday (fols. 24r-26v) I-4) Tuesday (fols. 26v-34r) I-5) Wednesday (fols. 34r-44r) I-6) Thursday (fols. 44r-48r) I-7) Friday (fols. 48r-57r) I-8) Saturday (fol. 57r) I-9) Symbolic interpretation of the creation (fols. 57v-70v) I-10) Creation of Eve (fols. 70v-98v) II) ʾAmmǝstu ʾaʿmadä mǝsṭir "The Five Pillars of Mystery" (fols. 99r-144v) II-1) Introduction (fols. 99r-103r) II-2) Mǝsṭirä śǝllase “Mystery of the Trinity” (fol. 103r) II-3) Mǝsṭirä śǝggawe “Mystery of the Incarnation” (fol. 103r) II-4) Mǝsṭirä ṭǝmqät “Mystery of Baptism” (fol. 103v) II-5) Mǝsṭirä qwǝrban “Mystery of the Eucharist” (fols. 103v-104r) II-6) Mǝsṭirä tǝnśaʾe mutan “Mystery of the Resurrection of the Dead” (fol. 104r) II-7) Symbolic interpretation of words Five, Pillar, and Mystery (fols. 104r-110v) II-8) Mǝgbarat “Good Deeds” (fols. 110v-121r) (cp. EMML no. 1315 2)(19)) II-9) Haymanot kä-mǝgbar “Faith and Good Deed” (fols. 121r-132v) II-10) Ṣadǝqan “The Righteous Ones” (fols. 132v-142v) II-11) Adam’s Faith (fols. 142v-144v).

owners.owner: The Ms. was probably in private possession of an individual mentioned in Additio 2 (only the second part of his name, ʾIyäsus, can be guessed). The ownership right of the Ms. possibly passed to the church after the owner diseased.

txstates.txstate: The back board is broken. The spine cover is slightly damaged. Some fols. are stained with water. Edges of fols. 32, 50, 56, 93, 95 are of irregular shape. Cuts amended on fols. 75, 82.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown leather (quarter cover). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover, poorly visible (2 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle)

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

bnstatedetails.bnstatedetail: It is slightly torn off at the tail.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) - [፩]I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – ፫III(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 19r-26v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – ፭V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – ፲X(8/fols. 75r- 82v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – ፲፪XII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 91r-98v) – [፩]XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – ፪XIV(10/fols. 107r-116v) – ፫XV(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 117r-126v) – ፬XVI(10/fols. 127r-136v) – ፭XVII(9; s.l.: 2, stub after 8/fols. 137r-145v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling and pricking are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; three pairs of lines on the incipit page of Text I alternating with black lines; the initial line in the beginnings of sections of Text I and II; two initial lines on the incipit page of Text II; corrections written interlineally (e.g., fols. 12v, 18r, 37v); elements of the punctuation signs; the word kǝfǝl “Part”; elements of Ethiopic numerals; some other words, e.g., wängel “Gospel” (fols. 15v, 17v, 30r), ʾorit, “Pentateuch” (fols. 25r, 48v), dǝrsan “Homily” (fol. 66v), liqawǝnt “Scholars”(fol. 120v).

additional.cont: Fol. 1v: Scribe’s entreat to God for help during the writing.

additional.add: Fol. 98v: ዝመጽሐፍ᎓ ዘ<...>
additional.tran: Fol. 98v: This book is of <…> (144v)
additional.det: - The note is written in the same hand as the main text. The personal name was scratched out but its second part might be ʾIyäsus. - An identical ownership note at the end of Text II, fol. 144r.

extras.extra: - Corrections written in the upper margin on fols. 32r, 38r, 38v. - Tämälläs-sign indicating the place where the omissions, written in the upper margin, belong: fols. 32r, 38r, 38v. - Chains of black and red dots as text dividers: fols. 26v, 34r, 44r, 48r, 57r, 98v, 110v, 121r, 132v, 142v, 144v. - Corrections written interlineally: e.g., fols. 32r, 35v, 41v, 59v, 64v. - Correction written over erasure: folo. 106r. - Spaces for rubricated names left unfilled in the supplication formula: fols. 69v-98v. - Cues for rubricator: fols. 69v-98v: . - Additional pagination in the upper margin on fols. 98r-144v. - Names and words erased: fols. 95r, 98v, 118r, 144v. - Writing and drawing exercises: fols. 144v, 145r, 145v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Quire marks are written in the upper left margin of fols. 35r, 43r, 51r, 59r, 67r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Uncoloured thread has been inserted in the upper margin of fol. 80.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r: Simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band (interlaces).
